sentences.en: "Opium" is a provocative, sensual, and voluptuous fragrance which makes all your senses vibrate.
sentences.cn: “鸦片”是一种刺激性的、能引起感官快感的香料，能使你所有的感官兴奋起来。

sentences.en: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
sentences.cn: 气流通过我们的声带，使之产生振动。

sentences.en: It's important to tighten up the wheels properly, otherwise they vibrate loose and fall off.
sentences.cn: 把轮子拧紧是很重要的，否则它们会因振动松动、脱落。

sentences.en: Molecules rotate and vibrate by virtue of their heat.
sentences.cn: 分子因热效应而发生转动和振动.

sentences.en: So any electric current will then cause the fibers to vibrate.
sentences.cn: 因此,任何电流都会导致纤维颤动.
弦在 拨弄 时会 颤动.

sentences.en: The bones, in their turn make your inner ears vibrate.
sentences.cn: 这些骨头义使你的内耳振动.

sentences.en: The ear has a set of filaments to vibrate in resonance with incoming sound-waves.
sentences.cn: 耳朵里有一组细丝能和进入的声波产生共振。

sentences.en: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
sentences.cn: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。

sentences.en: The ground shook and the cliffs seemed to vibrate.
sentences.cn: 大地在摇晃，悬崖好像在颤动。

sentences.en: The hammers strike the piano strings and vibrate them.
sentences.cn: 音锤敲击钢琴的弦并使之震动.

sentences.en: The plates not supported by bridges, will vibrate severely in car service.
sentences.cn: 极板得不到鞍座的支撑, 在汽车上使用时会强烈振动.

sentences.en: The rail continued to vibrate softly.
The rough road made the car vibrate.
sentences.cn: 坑坑洼洼的道路使车颠得厉害.

sentences.en: The strings of a piano vibrate when the keys are struck.
sentences.cn: 钢琴的琴键一弹琴弦就振动出声.

sentences.en: They will cause the speaker diaphragm to vibrate.
sentences.cn: 它们将引起扬声器薄膜振动.

sentences.en: Tom's heavy footsteps upstairs make the old house vibrate.
sentences.cn: 楼上汤姆的沉重脚步振动了整幢旧楼房.

words.tran_cn: 振动的；充满生气的；响亮的；战栗的
[力] 振动的，震动性的；摇摆的
振动器；[电子] 振子；振动按摩器；振动滚筒；簧片

trans.tran_en: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
